title: Part 1: Implementing a Light/Dark Mode Switcher
content: For this assignment, the first task was to create a light and dark mode for the website, and make use of a button that the user can then select to switch between the two modes. In order to do this, first, I set up my colors in CSS using variables. This way, all my JavaScript had to do was add or remove a dark-mode class from the tag. The last step was making sure the site remembers this choice. I used document.cookie as we learned in class to save the theme (light or dark). Then, when the page loads, a script checks for the cookie and applies the right theme.

title: Part 2: Loading Blog Posts from a JSON File
content: For Part 2 of the assignment, I didn't want to edit my HTML file every time I wrote a new blog post, so I learned how to load them from a separate file using JavaScript. I created a 'posts.json' file to hold an array of post objects. To get the data into my page, I used the fetch() function. Once I had the posts, I looped through them with forEach. Finally, for each post, I used document.createElement() to create the HTML elements and appendChild() to put all the pieces together and add them to my main blog page.
